DataElement.preferredDefinition: A device for use in high-throughput molecular analysis/screening of clinical tissue specimens.  Tissue microarrays spatially arrange 500-1000 tumor biopsies or other tissue onto a microarray block, which is then sliced into sections for probing DNA, RNA or protein targets to provide coincident analysis of all specimens in the array.  Subsequent sections can be analyzed with additional probes.:A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study._The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length: also, viscous consistency._Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is an Integer (32-bit two's complement).

Subsequent sections can be analyzed with additional probes.:A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study._The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length: also, viscous consistency.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A device for use in high-throughput molecular analysis/screening of clinical tissue specimens. Concepts.definition: A device for use in high-throughput molecular analysis/screening of clinical tissue specimens.  Tissue microarrays spatially arrange 500-1000 tumor biopsies or other tissue onto a microarray block, which is then sliced into sections for probing DNA, RNA or protein targets to provide coincident analysis of all specimens in the array.  Subsequent sections can be analyzed with additional probes.
A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Property.preferredDefinition: The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length: also, viscous consistency.

Concepts.definition: The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length: also, viscous consistency.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is an Integer (32-bit two's complement).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
